message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.AI 

This paper proposes a probabilistic modeling approach to infer user biases and latent intrinsic quality of an item based on observed aspect ratings. The paper uses Bayesian inference and handles non-conjugacy using a stick-breaking formulation coupled with Polya-Gamma auxiliary variable augmentation. The paper also demonstrates the effectiveness of the proposed model on two real-world datasets. Based on these characteristics, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
